oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Gene Autry interview - Bob Jennings
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Gene Autry (performer), conducted by Bob Jennings shortly after Autry was elected as president of the Country Music Association. Topics include Autry's records, horses, and radio and television stations.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones -- (01:15) Bob Jennings talks about country music week, and Gene Autry being elected president of the Country Music Association -- (02:11) Gene Autry thanks Bob, and says he is undeserving of such an honor, and any congratulations should hold off for a year or two -- (02:50) Autry says he will try to do his best in the position -- (03:03) Autry talks about his first record, in 1928 -- (03:20) Autry talks about working on the railroad at the time, during the depression -- (03:40) Autry talks about the growth of the record industry, and how records and movies come into existence -- (05:52) Autry talks about having 6 radio stations under his name, 2 being 50,000 watt stations, as well as 2 television stations -- (06:39) Autry talks about having made well over 200 records -- (07:01) Autry talks about his favorite record of his being Tumbling Tumbleweeds, but the biggest seller being Rudolph The Red Nosed Reindeer -- (07:50) Autry talks about his horses, Champion and Champion Jr., and how he uses them in his acts and daily life -- (08:48) Autry talks about his favorite songs being You're The Only Star In My Blue Heaven, South Of The Border, and Back In The Saddle Again -- (10:00) Autry says double mint chewing gum, and talks about trading and raising horses -- (10:30) Autry talks about rarely ever playing the guitar anymore, and never while on stage -- (11:40) Autry says he appreciates all his supporters in all his endeavors and concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Autry, Gene, 1907-1998; Jennings, Bob (Musician);
